fields.title: Sviluppo app: opzioni e frameworks
fields.intro:
Lo sviluppo di app per dispositivi mobili richiede un investimento importante, vista la molteplicità di dispositivi disponibili oggi sul mercato.

In questo articolo analizziamo le varie possibilità di sviluppo disponibili ad oggi, cercando di fornire un'analisi comparata di costi e vantaggi delle soluzioni disponibili.
fields.body:
##Sviluppare un'app mobile nel 2016

Lo sviluppo di app per dispositivi mobili richiede un investimento importante, spesso di un ordine diverso rispetto ad un sito web, vista la molteplicità di dispositivi disponibili oggi sul mercato e le competenze specialistiche necessarie per la realizzazione.

In questo articolo analizziamo le varie possibilità di sviluppo disponibili ad oggi, cercando di fornire un'analisi comparata di costi e vantaggi delle soluzioni disponibili.

### App native 
Le app native sono realizzate utilizzando linguaggi e frameworks di programmazione resi disponibili dagli stessi produttori dei sistemi operativi dei dispositivi mobili. Questo garantisce un accesso molto efficiente alle risorse del dispositivo sul quale viene utilizzato, potendone sfruttare al massimo le peculiarità.

Ciò consente di realizzare applicazioni molto performanti e con un "look and feel" molto integrato nel sistema operativo che le ospita, caratteristica che aumenta sensibilmente l'usabilità delle app per gli utenti, che ritrovano e sanno istintivamente usare elementi comuni tra diverse applicazioni, come menu, pulsanti, controlli di navigazione.

Questo approccio, essendo molto "specializzato" rispetto alle diverse architetture sulle quali andranno a funzionare le applicazioni, consente quindi di ottenere il massimo da ogni dispositivo, ma comporta costi significativi di implementazione e mantenimento di una app:

- Ogni sistema operativo (iOS, Android, Windows Mobile) richiede lo sviluppo di un progetto separato, con nessun riuso possibile del codice sviluppato per diverse piattaforme.
- Spesso anche il progetto dell'interfaccia deve essere diversificato a causa dei diversi componenti disponibili sulle varie piattaforme
- I vari SDK e framework per lo sviluppo di app native sono stati progettati unicamente per questo scopo, quindi richiedono competenze molto specifiche per ogni piattaforma


###App ibride
Già da alcuni anni è possibile sviluppare applicazioni pubblicabili sugli app store utilizzando tecnologie tipiche dello sviluppo dei siti web, cioè HTML, Javascript e CSS, anche grazie al progetto [Apache Cordova](https://cordova.apache.org/) (ex Phonegap, che ora è un marchio © Adobe Systems Inc).

Questo tipo di approccio consiste sostanzialmente nella strutturazione di una app mobile utilizzando una "WebView", ovvero un componente capace di renderizzare una pagina HTML e gestirne gli eventi, per visualizzare l'interfaccia utente e fornendo un layer di comunicazione tra questo componente e il sistema operativo sottostante, garantendo così la possibilità di accedere a funzioni non disponibili in ambito web, come l'accesso alla fotocamera o ai contatti del telefono.

Nel caso di Apache Cordova l'accesso alle funzioni native è realizzato tramite un'architettura a "plugin" che consente di implementare abbastanza facilmente delle funzionalità tramite codice nativo, che possono essere utilizzate all'interno del codice javascript della pagina web.


|---|Nativa|Ibrida|
|---|---|---|	
|Linguaggio|SDK Nativo|Web(js)+SDK Nativo|
|Accesso al dispositivo|Completo|Completo|
|Pubblicabile su store|Si|Si|
|Velocità|Massima|Non massima|
|Portabilità del codice|Bassa|Molto alta|


Vediamo però due approcci allo sviluppo di  app che cercano di superare i rispettivi limiti delle app ibride e native, con ottimi risultati in entrambi i casi.

### Ionic Framework


### React native


### Conclusioni

fields.title: I siti web responsive e l'importanza per il tuo business
fields.intro:
La diffusione dei dispositivi mobili ha modificato radicalmente la modalità di accesso al web e determinato un forte cambiamento nella struttura dei siti, che devono essere utilizzabili su schermi di piccole dimensioni.

In questo articolo daremo una nostra definizione di sito "responsive" e analizzeremo i vantaggi apportati da questo tipo di approccio.

fields.title: Mi serve una app o un sito web?
fields.intro:
Hai bisogno di un sito web o una app per la tua attività imprenditoriale o il tuo progetto di marketing?

Analizziamo le motivazioni e i vantaggi portati dalla realizzazione di una app mobile per la tua attività, evidenziandone le possibilità e le funzionalità aggiuntive rispetto ad un sito web.

fields.title: Guida a Boostrap 4
fields.intro: Questa è una piccola guida visiva per esaminare le principali differenze e le novità introdotte nell'ultima *release* del famoso framework creato da da Mark Otto e Jacob Thornton.
fields.body:
Questa è una piccola guida visiva per esaminare le principali differenze e le novità introdotte nell'ultima *release* del famoso framework creato da da Mark Otto e Jacob Thornton. Ecco cosa è cambiato: ###La griglia Oltre ai 4 tipi di griglia già esistenti in Bootstrap 3 (‘xs’, ’sm’, ‘md’ e ‘lg’), è stato introdotto un nuovo grid tier "**xl**", facendo salire a 5 il numero dei breakpoints. L'aggiunta di questo nuovo "livello" di griglia e il nuovo sistema di griglia con 5 breakpoints consentono di lavorare più facilmente al layout di dispositivi con schermo più piccolo di 544 px.

Bootstrap 4 Grid Demo

###I "Panels" sono diventati "Cards" Le classi .panel e .well che erano presenti nelle versioni precedenti di Bootstrap sono state rimpiazzate da un nuovo tipo di component, le **Card**. Le Bootstrap 4 Cards possono essere: - singole - raggruppate - della stessa altezza (inoltre grazie al flexbox mode ora è molto più facile creare card-groups della stessa altezza)

Card title

This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.

Last updated 3 mins ago

Card title

This card has supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content.

Last updated 3 mins ago

Card title

This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This card has even longer content than the first to show that equal height action.

Last updated 3 mins ago

--- Sempre per quanto riguarda le **Card** sono state introdotte alcune classi che consentono di cambiare rapidamente il background-color e il border-color (i colori più scuri richiedono l'uso della classe .card-inverse).

--- ###Buttons I buttons, come nella versione precedente, mantengono un design *flat* anche se più sottile. E se i colori di sfondo sono troppo pesanti? Non c'è problema, possiamo assegnargli la nuova classe .btn-outline-*
---
--- ###Utility Classes Una delle nuove features più potente è l'aggiunta del **responsive floats** che consente di assegnare ad un elemento la proprità *float* basandosi sui *grid tier*. Per esempio se assegnamo ad un elemento la classe pull-md-right, questo avrà il valore CSS float: right; solo sulla griglia di tipo **md** , cioè solo sugli schermi di medie dimensioni.

pull-md-right

--- Per posizionare il testo in modo *responsive* sono state introdotte le classi **text alignment**. Molto utili per il posizionamento degli elementi sono anche le classi **spacing** che utilizzano il margin e il padding. Per ora Bootstrap 4 è ancora in *alpha*, per vedere la documentazione completa basta andare sulla pagina [http://v4-alpha.getbootstrap.com/getting-started/introduction/](http://v4-alpha.getbootstrap.com/getting-started/introduction/)

fields.title: Ionic modal select
fields.intro: Componente per Ionic Framework rilasciato sotto licenza MIT
fields.body:
# ionic-modal-select Modal select for Ionic Framework based on [$ionicModal](http://ionicframework.com/docs/api/service/$ionicModal/) See all docs and examples on the [project site](http://inmagik.github.io/ionic-modal-select). We also have a simple [Codepen demo](http://codepen.io/bianchimro/pen/epYYQO?editors=101). ![animated example](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/6178230/screenshots/ionic-modal-picker.gif) ## IMPORTANT NOTICE **In order to survive, this project needs**: * proper testing: see [issue #26](https://github.com/inmagik/ionic-modal-select/issues/26) * co-maintainers: see [issue #54](https://github.com/inmagik/ionic-modal-select/issues/54) Any help on this is greatly appreciated. Comment directly those issues or contact me directly at mauro.bianchi at inmagik.com if you are interested in helping with this. ## Features * supports long list of object via collection-repeat * optional search bar * supports unsetting the chosen value (optional) * customizable modal classes, modal header and footer classes * customizable buttons text * multiple selectable options (experimental) ## Usage Get the files from github or install from bower: ``` bower install ionic-modal-select ``` Include `ionic-modal-select.js` or its minified version in your index.html: ```html ``` Add the module `ionic-modal-select` to your application dependencies: ```javascript angular.module('starter', ['ionic', 'ionic-modal-select']) ``` And you're ready to go. ## Directives ### modal-select This directive will transform the element into a modal select: when clicking the element a select dialog will be open, with options presented in a clickable list. Once the user clicks on an option, it will be set on the bound model. For this to work the following conditions must apply: * The element you use this directive must be clickable. * The directive requires ngModel to be set on the element * The directive expects an inner element of class "option" to define the options template The final value bound to your model will be determined as follow: * if you set the attribute `option-getter` will be set as `getterFunction(selectedItem)` * if you set the attribute `option-property` will be set as `selectedItem[propertyName]` * otherwise it will be set as the full object In case of "multiple" selection mode, the user is allowed to select multiple options and the bound ng-model will be a list containing the selected options, with the same logic of getting the value. #### Options option|meaning|accepted values|default ---|---|---|--- `options`|List of options to choose from|Array|| `options-expression`|The expression indicating how to enumerate a the options collection, of the format `variable in expression` – where variable is the user defined loop variable and expression is a scope expression giving the collection to enumerate. For example: `album in artist.albums or album in artist.albums | orderBy:'name'`.|expression|| `option-getter`|Optional method to get the value from the chosen item|function|not set| `option-property`|Optional property name to get as model value from the chosen item|string|not set| `multiple`|If set (to any value) enables "multiple" selection mode that allows the user to select more than one option. For each option, a checkbox will be rendered. *This feature is still experimental*. |string|not set| `modal-class`|The class for the modal (set on ``|string|'' `selected-class`|The class applied to the currently selected option (if any) in the modal list|string|'option-selected' `on-select`|Callback triggered on object select. Takes two arguments, `newValue` and `oldValue` with obvious meaning.|function call with arguments `newValue` and `oldValue`|not set `on-reset`|Callback triggered when value is resetted using the relevant ui interface. Takes no arguments.|function call|not set `on-close`|Callback triggered when modal is closed (in any way, uses 'modal.hidden' ionic event). Takes no arguments.|function call|not set `modal-title`|The title shown on the modal header|string|'Select an option' `header-footer-class`|The class for header and footer of the modal|string|'bar-stable' `cancel-button`|Text of the button for closing the modal without changing the value|string|'Cancel' `reset-button`|Text of the button for unsetting value in the modal dialog|string|'Reset' `hide-reset`|Hides the button for unsetting value in the modal dialog|string. Set to 'true' for hiding the button|false `use-collection-repeat`|Forces use of collection-repeat or ng-repeat for rendering options in the modal.| string "true", "false" | not set (automatically set according to number of options and `short-list-break` attribute) `short-list-break`|The maximum number of item in list to be rendered with `ng-repeat`.(if `use-collection-repeat` is not set) If the list has a number of options greater than this attribute it will be rendered with ionic `collection-repeat` directive instead. (see also `load-list-message` option)|integer|10 `load-list-message`|Message to be shown when loading a long list of options in the modal|string|'Loading' `has-search`|Whether to show a search bar to filter options.|set to "true" for showing the search bar|undefined `search-placeholder`|String placeholder in search bar.|string|'Search' `sub-header-class`|Class to be applied to the subheader containing the search bar (makes sense only if `has-search="true`) |string|'bar-stable' `cancel-search-button`|Text for the button for clearing search text (makes sense only if `has-search="true`) |string|'Clear' `clear-search-on-select`|Tells the directive to not clear the search bar content after user selection. Set to `false` to prevent clearing the search text.|boolean|true `search-properties`|Array of properties for the search. For example: In your controller `$scope.searchProperties = ['property1', 'property2'];` and in template attributes `search-properties="searchProperties"`|Array ### Passing in options The `modal-select` directive must be provided with a set of options to choose from This can be done in two ways: * via the `options` attribute, that accepts an array of values or objects. The directive will watch for changes in this array and modify its options accordingly. * via the `options-expression` attribute, that accepts an expression similar to what you would use with ionic `collection-repeat` directive, of the format `variable in expression` – where variable is the user defined loop variable and expression is a scope expression giving the collection to enumerate. For example: `album in artist.albums or album in artist.albums | orderBy:'name'`. This allows you to apply ordering or filtering without acting on the original array. ### Options templates This directive expects to find a single inner element of class "option" that is used to define the template of the options that can be selected. Options will be rendered as items into a list in the modal (The content of each option, rendered with your template, is wrapped in an element of class 'item item-text wrap' and the original ".option" element is removed). For example: ```html ``` Will be rendered in the modal as : ```html
{{option}}
``` ## Multiple selection mode From version 1.3.1, setting `multiple` attribute to any value other than "undefined" will enable the multiple selection on the widget. In this case, the user is allowed to select more than one option and options will be rendered with checkboxes in the selection modal. *This feature is still experimental*. ## Search bar From version 1.1.0 you can include a search bar into the modal for filtering options by simply adding the attribute `has-search="true"` to your `modal-select` element. Filtering is implemented with the angular `filter` filter, which searches recursively in all properties of the objects passed in as options. This means that you cannot search on "computed properties" right now. For example if you are using a custom setter you will be only able to search the original properties of the options. ### Examples #### Simplest one. This example shows a modal for choosing a number between 1 and 5. In your controller: ```js $scope.selectables = [1,2,3,4,5]; ``` In your template: ```html ``` #### Including a search bar To include a search bar in the previous example, just add `has-search="true"`: ```html ``` #### Objects as options In the following example we use some objects as options. In your controller: ```js $scope.selectables = [ { name: "Mauro", role : "navigator"}, { name: "Silvia", role : "chef"}, { name: "Merlino", role : "canaglia"} ]; ``` We'll explore different possibilities we have with this options. ##### 1. Setting the full object If we do not set `option-getter` or `option-property` attributes, the model is assigned to the full option object when an option is selected. ```html ``` ##### 2. Setting a property If `option-property` attribute is set to a string, the bound model assigned that property of the option object when an option is selected. For example if we set `option-getter="name"`, we get back the 'name' property of our options. ```html ``` ##### 3. Custom setter If a function call is passed via `option-getter` attribute, the bound model assignment is done by calling this function with the selected option as the only argument (named 'option'). For example if we do this in our controller: ```javascript $scope.getOption = function(option){ return option.name + ":" + option.role; }; ``` ```html ``` ##### 4. Specify the properties for search Specify in the array the properties' name for search `$scope.search_properties = ['propertie_1', 'propertie_2', '...'];`: ```javascript $scope.search_properties = ['name']; ``` ```html ``` We get back the phrase "Mauro:navigator", "Silvia:chef" or "Merlino:canaglia" if we click the previous defined options. ##### More examples [on the project site](http://inmagik.github.io/ionic-modal-select). ## Support this project This software package is available for free with a MIT license, but if you find it useful and want support its development consider buying a copy on the [Ionic Marketplace](http://market.ionic.io/plugins/ionic-modal-select) for just a few bucks.

fields.title: django-search-views
fields.intro:
Libreria per l'implementazione rapida di liste ricercabili con il framework web Django.
Rilasciata sotto licenza MIT.

fields.title: Amyko platform
fields.intro: Progetto pilota per l'integrazione della piattaforma AMYKO con servizi esterni

fields.title: python
fields.description:
Python è la nostra prima scelta per lo sviluppo di componenti Web lato server, per processi di elaborazione e trasformazione dati e per l'implementazione di molti altri componenti applicativi.
Con la sua filosofia "batteries included" e un ecosistema incredibile di frameworks e librerie, questo linguaggio ha consentito il successo di molti servizi e applicazioni a livello mondiale.

fields.title: python
fields.description:
Python is our primary choice when developing server-side web components, data processing and trasformation, and many other application components. 
With its "batteries included" philosophy and an incredible ecosystem of frameworks and libraries, this language empowers many successful services and applications.

fields.title: Javascript
fields.description:
From complex single-page applications, to complex interaction and and responsive web interfaces, javascript is the language that allows us to build rich user experiences in the web browser.
We use it for client-side web development, leveraging frameworks and tools that provide features like geographic maps, 3d rendering, charting and more.

fields.title: Javascript
fields.description:
From complex single-page applications, to complex interaction and and responsive web interfaces, javascript is the language that allows us to build rich user experiences in the web browser.
We use it for client-side web development, leveraging frameworks and tools that provide features like geographic maps, 3d rendering, charting and more.

fields.title: HTML5
fields.description:
HTML5 è l'attuale standard per la visualizzazione di documenti e per lo sviluppo di interfacce nel web.
Oltre ad essere uno standard e oltre a fornire un linguaggio comune per gli style documents, comprende features eccezionali come la geolocalizzazione, il client-side storage, il supporto audio e video e molto altro ancora.

fields.title: HTML5
fields.description:
HTML5 is the current standard for displaying documents and building interfaces over the web.
It is quickly becoming a standard and, besides providing a common language to style documents with pixel precision, incorporates powerful features such as geolocation, client-side storage, audio and video support and more.

fields.title: django
fields.description:
Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. Used in dozen of successful and world spread services and sites, it has a huge ecosystem of open source pluggable applications and frameworks. 
Working with python, Django is our natural choice for server-side application development, as it gives us the flexibility to build applications ranging from content management systems to rest APIs and geographic systems backends.

fields.title: django
fields.description:
Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. Used in dozen of successful and world spread services and sites, it has a huge ecosystem of open source pluggable applications and frameworks. 
Working with python, Django is our natural choice for server-side application development, as it gives us the flexibility to build applications ranging from content management systems to rest APIs and geographic systems backends.

fields.title: AngularJS
fields.description:
With the advent of complex and rich client-side applications comes the need of more structured and well-designed javascript code in web applications.
We have chosen to use the AngularJS framework by Google as its exensibility and modularity matches perfectly with our need to implement rich user interfaces and visualizations on web pages, while keeping a clean and well designed code base. 
AngularJS comes with a very rich ecosystem of plugins and libraries that make easy to implement a lot of common patterns.

fields.title: AngularJS
fields.description:
With the advent of complex and rich client-side applications comes the need of more structured and well-designed javascript code in web applications.
We have chosen to use the AngularJS framework by Google as its exensibility and modularity matches perfectly with our need to implement rich user interfaces and visualizations on web pages, while keeping a clean and well designed code base. 
AngularJS comes with a very rich ecosystem of plugins and libraries that make easy to implement a lot of common patterns.

fields.title: OpenLayers
fields.description:
Geographic data representation, with maps and geolocation features, has become very popular in web applications. OpenLayers is an open source web-mapping libraries with very advanced features, that allows interoperability with many geografic formats and data providers.
We use it to build web maps and webgis system that allow online editing of geographic features.

fields.title: OpenLayers
fields.description:
Geographic data representation, with maps and geolocation features, has become very popular in web applications. OpenLayers is an open source web-mapping libraries with very advanced features, that allows interoperability with many geografic formats and data providers.
We use it to build web maps and webgis system that allow online editing of geographic features.

fields.title: D3.js
fields.description:
D3 has become the de-facto standard for building diagrams and data visualizations on the web. Used by many researchers, journalists and digital story tellers, it introduces the concept of data-driven documents and allows the implementation of rich and interactive visualizations.
D3 is used in many charts, diagrams and web-based visualizations that we build at INMAGIK.

fields.title: D3.js
fields.description:
D3 has become the de-facto standard for building diagrams and data visualizations on the web. Used by many researchers, journalists and digital story tellers, it introduces the concept of data-driven documents and allows the implementation of rich and interactive visualizations.
D3 is used in many charts, diagrams and web-based visualizations that we build at INMAGIK.

fields.title: Sass
fields.description:
Sass is an extension of CSS that adds power and elegance to the basic language. It allows to use variables, nested rules, mixins, inline imports, and more. 
Sass is completely compatible with all versions of CSS. We take this compatibility seriously, so that you can seamlessly use any available CSS libraries.

fields.title: Sass
fields.description:
Sass is an extension of CSS that adds power and elegance to the basic language. It allows to use variables, nested rules, mixins, inline imports, and more. 
Sass is completely compatible with all versions of CSS. We take this compatibility seriously, so that you can seamlessly use any available CSS libraries.

fields.title: Bootstrap
fields.description:
Bootstrap, from Twitter, is a popular front-end framework and ui toolkit for developing responsive, mobile first web pages and applications.
It provides a strong foundation that can be easily customized and enriched to build unique designs and it features a big ecosystem of plugins and themes. We use it as a base of many of our projects.

fields.title: Bootstrap
fields.description:
Bootstrap, from Twitter, is a popular front-end framework and ui toolkit for developing responsive, mobile first web pages and applications.
It provides a strong foundation that can be easily customized and enriched to build unique designs and it features a big ecosystem of plugins and themes. We use it as a base of many of our projects.

fields.title: Apache Cordova
fields.description:
Apache Cordova, formerly Phonegap, is a framework that allows to build native mobile applications for iOS, Android and other mobile operative systems with HTML, Javascript and CSS. It provides access to native features such and camera, accelerometer, offline storage and GPS.
Cordova allows us to build mobile apps with the same tools we use for the web, supporting a broad range of platforms and devices with a common code base.

fields.title: Apache Cordova
fields.description:
Apache Cordova, formerly Phonegap, is a framework that allows to build native mobile applications for iOS, Android and other mobile operative systems with HTML, Javascript and CSS. It provides access to native features such and camera, accelerometer, offline storage and GPS.
Cordova allows us to build mobile apps with the same tools we use for the web, supporting a broad range of platforms and devices with a common code base.

fields.title: ionic
fields.description:
The beautiful, open source front-end framework for developing hybrid mobile apps with HTML5. 
Free and open source, Ionic offers a library of mobile-optimized HTML, CSS and JS components for building highly interactive apps. Built with Sass and optimized for AngularJS.

fields.title: ionic
fields.description:
The beautiful, open source front-end framework for developing hybrid mobile apps with HTML5. 
Free and open source, Ionic offers a library of mobile-optimized HTML, CSS and JS components for building highly interactive apps. Built with Sass and optimized for AngularJS.

fields.title: PostgreSQL
fields.description:
PostgreSQL, "The world's most advanced open source database", provide many advanced features found only in the most expensive commercial products, with the advatange of code openess and a long list of success cases.
We suggest PostgreSQL as database backend when we develop SQL database solutions.

fields.title: PostgreSQL
fields.description:
PostgreSQL, "The world's most advanced open source database", provide many advanced features found only in the most expensive commercial products, with the advatange of code openess and a long list of success cases.
We suggest PostgreSQL as database backend when we develop SQL database solutions.

fields.title: QGIS
fields.description:
QGIS, "A Free and Open Source Geographic Information System" is an open source software that allows to create, edit, visualise, analyse and publish geospatial information on Windows, Mac, Linux, BSD and soon on Android. 
We suggest using QGIS as it provides professional management of geographic information and compliance with inter-operable geographic format and standards.

fields.title: QGIS
fields.description:
QGIS, "A Free and Open Source Geographic Information System" is an open source software that allows to create, edit, visualise, analyse and publish geospatial information on Windows, Mac, Linux, BSD and soon on Android. 
We suggest using QGIS as it provides professional management of geographic information and compliance with inter-operable geographic format and standards.

fields.title: PostGIS
fields.description:
PostGIS extends PostgreSQL object-relational database with spatial capabilities. It adds support for geographic objects allowing location queries to be run in SQL, and provides advanced geospatial functionalities.
It is supported by a set of well known open source tools that allow interoperability and conversion between PostGIS and other geographic formats. 
We use it with GeoDjango to build geo-aware web applications.

fields.title: PostGIS
fields.description:
PostGIS extends PostgreSQL object-relational database with spatial capabilities. It adds support for geographic objects allowing location queries to be run in SQL, and provides advanced geospatial functionalities.
It is supported by a set of well known open source tools that allow interoperability and conversion between PostGIS and other geographic formats. 
We use it with GeoDjango to build geo-aware web applications.

fields.title: GNU/Linux
fields.description:
As Wikipedia states, "The development of Linux is one of the most prominent examples of free and open source software collaboration".
Linux is the operating system of our choice for deploying our services and applications components, ranging to database to web and application servers. We currently use Ubuntu and Debian distributions.

fields.title: GNU/Linux
fields.description:
As Wikipedia states, "The development of Linux is one of the most prominent examples of free and open source software collaboration".
Linux is the operating system of our choice for deploying our services and applications components, ranging to database to web and application servers. We currently use Ubuntu and Debian distributions.
